    • applyTransformation

      public algorithms.util.PairIntArray[] applyTransformation(TransformationParameters params, algorithms.util.PairIntArray[] edges)
      transform the given edges using the given parameters. Note, the rotation is applied in a clockwise direction (which is in the -z direction using right hand rule).
      Parameters:
      params -
      edges -
      Returns:

    • applyTransformation

      public algorithms.util.PairIntArray[] applyTransformation(double rotInRadians, double scale, double translationX, double translationY, double centroidX, double centroidY, algorithms.util.PairIntArray[] edges)
      transform the given edges using the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      rotInRadians - rotation in radians. Note, the rotation is applied in a clockwise direction (which is in the -z direction using right hand rule).
      scale -
      translationX - translation along x axis in pixels
      translationY - translation along y axis in pixels
      centroidX - the horizontal center of the reference frame for edges. this should be the center of the image if edges points are in the original image reference frame.
      centroidY - the vertical center of the reference frame for edges. this should be the center of the image if edges points are in the original image reference frame.
      edges -
      Returns:

    • applyTransformation

      public List<algorithms.util.PairIntArray> applyTransformation(TransformationParameters params, List<algorithms.util.PairIntArray> edges)
      transform the given edges using the given parameters. Note, the rotation is applied in a clockwise direction (which is in the -z direction using right hand rule).
      Parameters:
      params -
      edges -
      Returns:

      transform the given edges using the given parameters.
      Parameters:

      translationY - translation along y axis in pixels
      centroidX - the horizontal center of the reference frame for edges. this should be the center of the image if edges points are in the original image reference frame.

      edges -
      Returns:

      translationY - translation along y axis in pixels
      centroidX - the horizontal center of the reference frame for edges. this should be the center of the image if edges points are in the original image reference frame.

    • applyTransformation

      public GreyscaleImage applyTransformation(GreyscaleImage input, TransformationParameters params, int outputWidth, int outputHeight)
      apply transformation params to the image input. Note, the rotation is applied in a clockwise direction (which is in the -z direction using right hand rule).

      outputHeight -
      Returns:

    • applyTransformation

      public Image applyTransformation(Image input, TransformationParameters params, int outputWidth, int outputHeight)
      apply transformation params to image input. Note, the rotation is applied in a clockwise direction (which is in the -z direction using right hand rule). NOTE that currently the additional data in an ImageExt beyond an Image instance is not transformed too.
      Parameters:
      input -
      params -
      outputWidth -
      outputHeight -
      Returns:

    • transformXY

      public float[][] transformXY(float rotationInDegrees, float[][] xy)
      given a two-dimensional array of x and y, apply rotation to them and return the result. Note, the rotation is applied in a clockwise direction (which is in the -z direction using right hand rule).
      Parameters:

      xy -
      Returns:

    • rotate

      public void rotate(int rotationInDegrees, int x, int y, float[] outputX, float[] outputY, int outputIndex)
      apply rotationInDegrees to (x, y) and return the result in the arrays outputX and outputY. Note, the rotation is applied in a clockwise direction (which is in the -z direction using right hand rule).
      Parameters:
      rotationInDegrees -
      x -
      y -
